description: Change of use from Coffee Shop / Retail (Class A1) to Drinking Establishment (Class A4) at ground and basement level.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the end of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: L.01; EX/01; PP/01B; PP/02A; PP03A (Existing section); PP/03B (Proposed section); PP04A; PL/02; M-100; Environmental Noise Assessment (March 2010, Acoustics Plus).

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interest of proper planning.
Condition : 3 - The use hereby permitted shall not be carried out outside the following times 09:00-23:30 hours Monday to Thursday, 09:00-00:00 hours Fridays and Saturdays and 09:00-22:30 hours on Sundays. It shall not be carried out at any time on Bank Holidays.  No persons/customers shall be on the premises in connection with the use outside of these times.

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the area generally in accordance with the requirements of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006 policies SD6 (Amenity of occupiers and neighbours), R2 (Impact of retail and entertainment uses) and R3 (Assessment of food and drink uses and licensed entertainment); the London Borough of Camden Local Development Framework Core Strategy policies CS5 (Managing the impact of growth and development), CS7 (Promoting Camden's centres and shops) and CS8 (Promoting a successful and inclusive Camden economy); and the London Borough of Camden Local Development Framework Development Policies DP12 (Supporting strong centres and managing the impact of food, drink and entertainment and other town centre uses) and DP26 (Managing the impact of development on occupiers and neighbours).

Condition : 4 - Before the use commences sound insulation shall be provided for the building in accordance with a scheme to be first approved by the local planning authority. The use shall thereafter not be carried out other than in complete compliance with the approved scheme.                                                             
Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the area generally in accordance with the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006 policies SD6 (Amenity of occupiers and neighbours), R2 (Impact of retail and entertainment uses) and R3 (Assessment of food and drink uses and licensed entertainment); the London Borough of Camden Local Development Framework Core Strategy policies CS5 (Managing the impact of growth and development), CS7 (Promoting Camden's centres and shops) and CS8 (Promoting a successful and inclusive Camden economy); and the London Borough of Camden Local Development Framework Development Policies DP12 (Supporting strong centres and managing the impact of food, drink and entertainment and other town centre uses) and DP26 (Managing the impact of development on occupiers and neighbours).
Condition : 5 - No music shall be played on the premises in such a way as to be audible within any adjoining premises or on the adjoining highway. 

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the area generally in accordance with the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006 policies SD6 (Amenity of occupiers and neighbours), R2 (Impact of retail and entertainment uses) and R3 (Assessment of food and drink uses and licensed entertainment); the London Borough of Camden Local Development Framework Core Strategy policies CS5 (Managing the impact of growth and development), CS7 (Promoting Camden's centres and shops) and CS8 (Promoting a successful and inclusive Camden economy); and the London Borough of Camden Local Development Framework Development Policies DP12 (Supporting strong centres and managing the impact of food, drink and entertainment and other town centre uses) and DP26 (Managing the impact of development on occupiers and neighbours).
Condition : 6 - Noise levels at a point 1 metre external to sensitive facades shall be at least 5dB(A) less than the existing background measurement (LA90), expressed in dB(A) when all plant/equipment (or any part of it) is in operation unless the plant/equipment hereby permitted will have a noise that has a distinguishable, discrete continuous note (whine, hiss, screech, hum) and/or if there are distinct impulses (bangs, clicks, clatters, thumps), then the noise levels from that piece of plant/equipment at any sensitive faï¿½ade shall be at least 10dB(A) below the LA90, expressed in dB(A).

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the neighbouring premises in accordance with the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006 policies SD6 (Amenity of occupiers and neighbours); SD7 (Light, noise and vibration pollution); SD8 (Noise and disturbance); the London Borough of Camden Local Development Framework Core Strategy policy CS5 (Managing the impact of growth and development); and the London Borough of Camden Local Development Framework Development Policies DP26 (Managing the impact of development on occupiers and neighbours) and DP28 (Noise and vibration).
Condition : 7 - Notwithstanding the drawings hereby approved, the kitchen extract and grilles located at basement level to the rear shall not be installed, and no primary cooking shall take place on the site without the prior approval of the Local Planning Authority. 

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises in terms of fumes and smells in accordance with the requirements of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006 policies SD6 (Amenity of occupiers and neighbours), R2 (Impact of retail and entertainment uses) and R3 (Assessment of food and drink uses and licensed entertainment); the London Borough of Camden Local Development Framework Core Strategy policies CS5 (Managing the impact of growth and development), CS7 (Promoting Camden's centres and shops) and CS8 (Promoting a successful and inclusive Camden economy); and the London Borough of Camden Local Development Framework Development Policies DP12 (Supporting strong centres and managing the impact of food, drink and entertainment and other town centre uses) and DP26 (Managing the impact of development on occupiers and neighbours).
Condition : 8 - An internal refuse store shall be provided and permanently retained whilst the approved use is in operation.

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the neighbouring premises and the area generally in accordance with the requirements of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006 policies SD6 (Amenity of occupiers and neighbours), R2 (Impact of retail and entertainment uses) and R3 (Assessment of food and drink uses and licensed entertainment); the London Borough of Camden Local Development Framework Core Strategy policies CS5 (Managing the impact of growth and development), CS7 (Promoting Camdens centres and shops) and CS8 (Promoting a successful and inclusive Camden economy); and the London Borough of Camden Local Development Framework Development Policies  DP12 (Supporting strong centres and managing the impact of food, drink and entertainment and other town centre uses) and DP26 (Managing the impact of development on occupiers and neighbours).
